meanings.definition: Not based on or behaving according to what is morally right or fair.
meanings.sent1: The decision to punish the innocent child was unjust.
meanings.sent2: It is unjust to treat people differently based on their appearance.
meanings.sent3: It would be unjust if the winner of the race was disqualified for no reason.
meanings.sent4: The unjust ruler oppressed his people with harsh laws.
meanings.sent5: The unjust treatment of animals in the circus sparked outrage among animal lovers.

meanings.sent1: The unfair distribution of resources was unjust.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's grading system seemed unjust to the students.
meanings.sent3: It felt unjust when the last piece of cake was taken before I could have any.
meanings.sent4: The unjust advantage given to the opposing team led to their victory.
meanings.sent5: The unjust decision left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.

meanings.sent1: The corrupt government was unjust in its treatment of citizens.
meanings.sent2: The company's policies were deemed unjust by the employees.
meanings.sent3: It seemed unjust that only a select few were allowed entry to the exclusive club.
meanings.sent4: The unjust actions of the landlord caused distress among the tenants.
meanings.sent5: The unjust society favored the wealthy while neglecting the poor.
